prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. 1.1 Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 1.2 Within the created coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane (face\\_1): * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point[0.0, 0.0], End Point[0.75, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point[0.75, 0.0], End Point[0.75, 0.5] + Line 3: Start Point[0.75, 0.5], End Point[0.0, 0.5] + Line 4: Start Point[0.0, 0.5], End Point[0.0, 0.0] 1.3 Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 1.4 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 1.5 Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.25 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Boolean operation: Create a new solid body Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Rounded Corners Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. 2.1 Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.25] 2.2 Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane (face\\_1): * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point[0.0, 0.0], End Point[0.1828, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point[0.1828, 0.0], End Point[0.1828, 0.5] + Line 3: Start Point[0.1828, 0.5], End Point[0.0, 0.5] + Line 4: Start Point[0.0, 0.5], End Point[0.0, 0.0] 2.3 Scale the 2D sketch by 0.5. 2.4 Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 2.5 Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.25 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.5 * Boolean operation: Join the current part with the preceding CAD models</description>
